topics.title: Introduction and AI Vibe Coding Discussion
topics.summary: Welcome to the community chat focused on AI and vibe coding. Kushti mentions using AI for writing tests and working on basis tracker server. Discussion of Louis Vatra creating an entire Rust node using AI coding.

topics.title: HQ's Android Mobile dApp Development
topics.summary: HQ demonstrates his AI-coded Android mobile dApp that provides in-wallet swapping functionality. The frontend was completed in about one hour using AI, allowing users to swap ERG for other blockchain assets directly in their mobile wallet.

topics.title: QX's Unstoppable IPFS Applications Demo
topics.summary: QX demonstrates three AI-coded applications hosted on IPFS: Site (reporting app), Say (Twitter alternative), and Enfermo (messaging). These applications interact with Ergo blockchain and are designed to be unstoppable with no central server dependency.

topics.title: Encryption and Messaging Security Discussion
topics.summary: HQ suggests using sender private key for message encryption instead of passcodes. QX explains technical limitations with Nautilus wallet exposure and the challenges of implementing public key cryptography for the messaging system.

topics.title: MewMart Shopping Cart AI Development
topics.summary: HQ showcases new MewMart features including bulk listing, bulk buying, and drag-and-drop shopping cart functionality. The frontend was 50% AI-generated while backend blockchain logic was manually coded.

topics.title: AI Coding Challenges and Token Limits
topics.summary: Discussion of managing context windows and token limits when AI coding large applications. Kushti explains using specs and working piece by piece with agents like QuantCode to manage complexity.

topics.title: Basis Testing and Mining Pool Conversion
topics.summary: Fitz shares experience with AI-coded basis testing using Alice, Carol, Bob test scenarios. QX demonstrates converting a Perl-based mining pool application to pure HTML/JavaScript for IPFS hosting.

topics.title: Infrastructure Optimization with AI
topics.summary: QX explains using AI to identify and fix database performance issues on peer-to-peer infrastructure. AI helped create PostgreSQL indexes to handle large queries that would have been impossible to solve without expert help.

topics.title: AI Smart Contract Verification and Auditing
topics.summary: Kushti discusses using LLMs to verify and audit Ergo smart contracts before deployment. Common issues like missing register checks and double-spending vulnerabilities can be efficiently detected by AI.

topics.title: New Developers and Community Growth
topics.summary: Recognition of new developers Michael and CannonQ who are contributing through AI-assisted coding. Discussion of CannonQ's Cyberverse Viewer and wallet history tools built with AI assistance.

topics.title: On-chain AI Agents Discussion
topics.summary: HQ asks about implementing AI agents directly on-chain within smart contracts. Kushti explains that AI logic would remain off-chain with trusted gateways, as true on-chain AI execution isn't practical.

topics.title: Economic Implications of Easier Development
topics.summary: Kushti discusses how AI-assisted development changes blockchain economics. With 100x more developers, differentiation comes from blockchain fundamentals, sound economic principles, and solid monetary foundations rather than just technical capabilities.

topics.title: AI Hackathon and Template Proposal
topics.summary: HQ proposes creating GitHub templates in multiple frameworks with wallet connection examples for AI-based hackathons. This would provide base code for developers to build upon and encourage more blockchain application development.

topics.title: Pull Request Quality and Maintainer Challenges
topics.summary: Discussion of challenges maintainers face with low-quality AI-generated pull requests. Kushti mentions receiving hundreds of vibe-coded PRs, most being low-quality 'slop' that requires significant review time.

topics.title: Voice AI and Educational Content
topics.summary: QX demonstrates ChatterTTS voice cloning technology and proposes using it to create Deco educational content with familiar community voices. Kushti mentions X10xin's work on a Sigma book analyzing repositories with AI agents.

topics.title: Closing and Next Session Planning
topics.summary: Wrap-up of the AI coding discussion with plans for next week's session focused on ChainCash and basis-related topics. Encouragement for developers to participate in the community regardless of experience level.
